 022:     '''
 023:     This is a VBO that has a fixed size for the amount of vertex data. While
 024:     the MemoryBlock will hold a fixed amount of data, it is possible we will
 025:     upload a different amount of data per-frame to GL. This allows us to render
 026:     up to the maximum amount that will fill MemoryBlock without having to
 027:     reallocate memory on the cpu side of things.
 028: 
 029:     **Attributes: (Cython Access Only)**
 030:         **memory_block** (MemoryBlock): MemoryBlock holding the data for this
 031:         VBO.
 032: 
 033:         **usage** (int): The usage hint for this VBO, currently only
 034:         GL_STREAM_DRAW is supported. Pass in 'stream' when initializing.
 035:         Any other argument will raise VBOUsageException.
 036: 
 037:         **target** (int): The target of the buffer when binding. Can be either
 038:         GL_ARRAY_BUFFER or GL_ELEMENT_ARRAY_BUFFER at the moment. When
 039:         initializing pass in either 'array' or 'elements' respectively. Any
 040:         other argument with raise a VBOTargetException
 041: 
 042:         **flags** (short): State used by Kivy during rendering.
 043: 
 044:         **id** (GLuint): The id assigned by GL for this buffer. Returned from
 045:         glGenBuffers.
 046: 
 047:         **size_last_frame** (unsigned int): The number of elements rendered
 048:         during the last frame. Used to determine whether we should
 049:         glBufferData or glBufferSubData when updating the vbo.
 050: 
 051:         **data_size** (unsigned int): The amount of data to be rendered next
 052:         frame.
 053: 
 054:         **vertex_format** (KEVertexFormat): The object containing data about
 055:         the vertex format for this VBO.
 056:     '''
 057:
